properties.Comments / Observations: Most damages caused by poor maintenance of the roof.

There was limited access to the building, so power sockets, doors, windows and rooms were not accounted for. Just an estimate.
The building is routinely maintained.

properties.PI name: Chuuk Department of Health Services / Chuuk State Hospital
properties.Comments / Observations:
Deputy contact: restyshotaro@gmail.com
Not possible to see back of the building site as there is no access to it.
Power plant on site.
Proper illumination of surroundings.
Not possible to count all of the windows and doors as it is a hospitals with patients. Maintenance of the hospital was going to count them but never got back to IOM.

Located next to the clan hall.
Toilets are not connected to the grid. They need to add water to the bowl to flush.
Only source of water is rain water and the tank lasts less than a month. They'd like to have another tank to collect more water. They'd like to build 2 more toilets.
Security is a concern. They'd like to build a fence as there have been instances where water is stolen or people access toilets.
There are no mosquito nets, but there are a lot of mosquitos.

Serves over 2000 students
- 36 classrooms + 3 offices
- Was a World Teach school. Has partnered with a university to eventually offer college level
- 600 laptops and 40 kindles available at the computer lab
- Toilets will be replaced for steel toilets.

The building functions as a community hall as well. 
Water tank is damaged since the typhoon.
Bucket water has to be used to flush the toilets. Sinks are broken.

There is no connection to the main water grid. They're trying to get connected.
There should be one toilet per 50 students. There should be 8 toilets; not 6. One of the toilets is clogged.
They had internet before. They are reapplying to get it back.

There is access to the second floor for disabled, although the ramp is a little steep. 
The organisation offers different activities, like sewing and computer lessons. It also counts with clinics, mainly focused on women's care.
There is a secondary building that serves as a nursery, and dorms for volunteers in the main building.
There are 2 water tanks on site; one for each building.

There is no maintenance to the building since typhoon Maysak.
The jail is located next to the building. It is not damaged, but had not had any use since the typhoon.

They can only use the toilet if they have collected enough rainwater.
They depend on natural light for classes.
They use bucket water to flush toilets. 5 of the toilets are outside of the premises.
In 2011 telecom office cut the internet off. Antenna is broken since typhoon Maysak.
3 water tanks of 1500 gallons each. 1 tank of 2000 gallons. 4 tanks of 500 gallons each.

They need more solar panels and to fix the antenna, as currently there is no electricity.
